00063 /**
00064  * Calculate the natural log ratio for two probeset signal
00065  *
00066  *@para signalA -- e.x. signal channel 
00067  *@para signalB -- e.x. background channel
00068  *
00069  */
00070 double logRatio(double sigA, double sigB);
00071 
00072 /** 
00073  * Open and read a target distribution from a text file. Must have a column
00074  * called 'intensities' with distribution quantiles sorted from highest to 
00075  * lowest.
00076  * 
00077  * @param fileName - text file containing column of quantiles.
00078  * @para sketch - vector that stores the sketch.
00079  */
00080 
00081 void  loadTargetSketchFromFile(const char *fileName, std::vector<float> &sketch);
00082 
00083 
00084 /** 
00085  * Read in the precomputed genotypes from a tab delimited file. Must
00086  * be a column for each Celfile with same header name as celfile and an row
00087  * for every snp to be analyzed. There can be extra columns and order of columns
00088  * is not important as the resulting order will be the same as the colNames
00089  * vector. Steal from GenoSeedTxt. 
00090  * @param fileName - text file containing the known genotype calls
00091  * @para colNames - the name of samples. 
00092  * @para knownCalls -- the map that store knownCalls infomation for each SNP.
00093  */
00094 void loadSNPHints(std::string fileName, 
00095                   std::vector<std::string> &colNames,
00096                   std::map<std::string, std::vector<affx::GType> > &knownCalls);

00099 enum Transformation {
00100     MvA, ///< Minus Vs Average
00101     RvT, ///< R vs Theta
00102     CES, ///< Contrast Extremes Stretch (nee  south san francisco).
00103     CCS  ///< Contrast Centers Stretch (nee alternative south san francisco).
00104   };
00105 
00106 /** the engine that transforms the data */
00107 void valueForTransformation(double aVal, double bVal, enum Transformation trans, double K, double &xVal, double &yVal);
00108 enum Transformation transformationForString(const std::string &s);

00110   /**
00111    * Convert a transformation enum to string representation
00112    * @param t - tranformation enum value.
00113    * @return - text description of enumeration.
00114    */
00115 std::string stringForTransformation(enum Transformation t);

00118  * Return the calumn names for the values generated by a given transformation
00119  * @param t - tranformation enum value.
00120  * @return - a pair of column names
00121  */
00122 std::pair<std::string,std::string> columnNamesForTransformation(enum Transformation t);

00130 /**
00131  * Contrast Centers Stretch. In 2007 this is the current favorite for
00132  * algorithms, scales values between -1 and 1.
00133  * \f$ X = asinh(K * (A-B)/(A+B)) / asinh(K) \f$ <br>
00134  * \f$ Y = log_2(A + B) \f$ <br>
00135  *
00136  * @param a - Value (usually summarized intensity) from A allele.
00137  * @param b - Value (usually summarized intensity) from B allele.
00138  */
00139 void ContrastCentersStretch(double K, double a, double b, double &x, double &y);
00140 
00141 /** 
00142  * Contrast Extremes Stretch. 
00143  * \f$ X = sinh(K * (A-B)/(A+B)) / sinh(K) \f$ <br> 
00144  * \f$ Y = log_2(A + B) \f$ <br> 
00145  * 
00146  * @param K -
00147  * @param a - Value (usually summarized intensity) from A allele.
00148  * @param b - Value (usually summarized intensity) from B allele.
00149  * @param x -
00150  * @param y -
00151  */
00152 void ContrastExtremesStretch(double K, double a, double b, double &x, double &y);
00153 
00154 /** 
00155  * Calculate the median PM values for the A and B alleles given data
00156  * in cel file.
00157  * 
00158  * @param cel - Cel file of data.
00159  * @param ps - ProbeSet for determining A and B alleles.
00160  * @param Amedian - Filled in with median PM A value.
00161  * @param Bmedian - Filled in with median PM B value.
00162  * 
00163  * @return 
00164  */
00165 bool alleleMedians(affymetrix_fusion_io::FusionCELData *cel, 
00166                    const ProbeSet *ps, 
00167                    float &Amedian, float &Bmedian);
